title: 'Extremism and Its Support: Developing More Effective Policy Responses'
abstractText:
One specific challenge facing policy-makers at the national and local levels is to understand, and deliver effective responses to, extremist movements. In particular, building on its work in the area of integration and extremism, the Department for Communities and Local Government (DCLG) aims to increase its knowledge and understanding about right-wing extremism. In co-operation with the DCLG as project partner, the aims of this six-month knowledge-exchange are to:

  • support impact-generation from past research while contributing directly to the work of a national-level policy community
  • to promote the application of accumulated academic knowledge on right-wing extremism and related issues
  • to strengthen wider networks between academics and policy-makers
  • to facilitate the co-production of creative and concrete policy ideas.

The project is anchored in a six-month placement at DCLG, where the applicant will draw on his past research, and also the work of other social scientists, to directly inform policy development.
impactText: My findings have been used across central UK government as this secondment fed into the Department for Communities and Local Government, the Home Office, Downing Street and other government agencies. Education,Government, Democracy and Justice Societal,Policy & public services
findingsText: I have worked directly with non-academic policy makers to strengthen wider understanding about right-wing extremism and its effects upon society. This particular project has led to the establishment of broad networks between academics and policy makers who work in this and similar areas. Education,Government, Democracy and Justice
